purpose: To provide an open-source alternative for connecting and retrieving information from various external sources like search engines, Slack, and Notion.
principle: Utilizes a combination of FastAPI and LangChain to interact with external APIs and gather information for user queries.
reusability: Offers APIs for integration with various platforms, supports modular extensions for new data sources.
limitations: Alpha status may indicate incomplete features and potential bugs; integration with some platforms may require additional setup.
name: SurfSense
description: Open Source Alternative to NotebookLM / Perplexity / Glean, connected to external sources such as search engines (Tavily, Linkup), Slack, Linear, Notion, YouTube, GitHub and more.
highlight: Integrates with multiple external sources for comprehensive data retrieval and analysis.
